channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report E-2024030591
item.description:
Report E-2024030591

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: CARTERSVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported a spill that occurred on 2/27 in a trailer in Cartersville, GA. The spill consisted of (1) 5 gallon plastic jug of Zep Industrial Purple Degreaser & Cleaner (UN3266), which was punctured by nails protruding from the pallet, causing a "small" amount of liquid to release onto the container and a small amount onto the wood on the pallet. The Sds was reviewed with the terminal and it was decided they were able to clean it with PPE onsite. The terminal placed the PPE and spent absorbents and product into a 20 gallon poly drum and it was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • Description: Norfolk Southern personnel reported a possible leaking tank car at Norris Yard. Mechanical personnel on scene noted a strong odor near tank car GLNX23581. Upon inspection by a contractor, the source of the odor was the manway. The manway was venting as the result of not having a manway gasket. A manway gasket was installed and the car was released to transportation.

item.title: Report X-2024030868

There is a small hole at the lid at the top of the pail. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: No injuries. Immediate clean up.
